content.en: Path loss prediction: Researchers have been investigating the use of algorithms, specifically neural networks and machine learning methods, to predict path loss in various environments such as urban areas, macrocells, aircraft cabins, and tropical regions. These algorithms are compared to other models and empirical methods to assess their accuracy and performance. The findings suggest that machine learning models, particularly neural networks, can outperform traditional models in predicting path loss, leading to improved signal prediction accuracy in wireless networks.
content.da: Stipulering af signaltab: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer, specifikt neurale netværk og maskinlæringsmetoder, til at forudsige signaltab i forskellige miljøer som byområder, makroceller, flykabiner og tropiske regioner. Disse algoritmer sammenlignes med andre modeller og empiriske metoder for at vurdere deres nøjagtighed og præstation. Resultaterne viser, at maskinlæringsmodeller, især neurale netværk, kan overgå traditionelle modeller i forudsigelsen af signaltab, hvilket fører til forbedret præcision i signalforudsigelse i trådløse netværk.
